doc:
Fanny Brice https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanny_Brice 0 Fania Borach (October 29, 1891 – May 29, 1951), known professionally as Fanny Brice or Fannie Brice, was an American illustrated song model, comedienne, singer, theater, and film actress who made many stage, radio, and film appearances and is known as the creator and star of the top-rated radio comedy series The Baby Snooks Show. Thirteen years after her death, Brice was portrayed on the Broadway stage by Barbra Streisand in the 1964 musical Funny Girl; Streisand also starred in its 1968 film adaptation, for which she won an Oscar. Fania_Borach ( October_29_,_1891 – May_29_,_1951 ) , known professionally as Fanny_Brice_or_Fannie_Brice , was an_American_illustrated_song_model , comedienne , singer , theater , and film_actress who made many_stage , radio , and film_appearances and is_known as the_creator_and_star of the_top-rated_radio_comedy series The_Baby_Snooks_Show . Thirteen_years after her_death , Brice was_portrayed on the_Broadway_stage by Barbra_Streisand in the_1964_musical_Funny_Girl ; Streisand also starred in its_1968_film_adaptation , for which she won an_Oscar .
